You are using the key influencers visual to identify which factors affect the quantity of items sold in an order.

✑ Customer Country
✑ Product Category
✑ Supplier Country
✑ Sales Employee
✑ Supplier Name
✑ Product Name
✑ Customer City
The key influencers visual returns the results shown in the following exhibit.
//IMG//

What can you identify from the visual?

There is no information on Product Category in the exhibit
On the righ pane, column for Cork goes above the red dotted lin reporting the average meaning they are ordering more than the average

'A' is correct:
The value in left pane is obtain by divide the char length by the average value.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-influencers?tabs=powerbi-desktop.

The analysis on the left shows the INCREASE IN AVERAGE. B states that customers order 20% MORE than THE average, shown in red in the column chart. Therefore, the answer is A.

JUST TYPE "EXAMTOPICS PL-300 TOPIC X1 AND QUESTION X2" 
Here X1 is Topic Number and X2 is Question Number.
For example, In order to study topic 3 question 8. Type Examtopics pl-300 topic 3 question 8 in google. You have to search each question individually in order to study the questions without buying contributor access.

All the best!

Tab order is correct. Dont think about the report tab, thats the throw-off. Think tab as in pressing the tab key on your keyboard on a webpage. As you tab thru the page, certain fields get highlighted. So for this example, you want to "tab" thru the report in the correct order: the order should be the flow in which a user reads a report.

reference:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/create-reports/desktop-accessibility-creating-reports

questions.question_text:
You are creating a Power BI single-page report.

Some users will navigate the report by using a keyboard, and some users will navigate the report by using a screen reader.

You need to ensure that the users can consume content on a report page in a logical order.

What should you configure on the report page?

You are configuring a Power BI report for accessibility as shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to change the default colors of all three visuals to make the report more accessible to users who have color vision deficiency.

Which two settings should you configure in the Customize theme window? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B- theme colors cause you can customize it yourself
C- Divergent specifically address color blind users

D is not correct because it uses colors like RED, GREEN, which hurts visual impaired users

Selected Answer: BD
In a PBI report you can customize Theme colors (View > Customize Theme > Name and colors) setting colors for three different palettes:
 Theme colors: standard colors for the entire report
 Sentiment colors: colors used fot KPIs and WATERFALL charts 
 (positive/negative/neutral values)
 Divergent colors: colors used in conditional formatting (to set Gradient)

Since our PBI report has a table, a KPI and a Waterfall chart, solution must be B & D
Theme colors are the ones used in the table
Sentiment colors are the ones used in the KPI and the Waterfall

In my opinion: B and C
Sentiment colors are assigned to visuals like waterfall charts and KPIs, so adjusting them will impact two of the three visuals in our report. Divergent colors are used with gradient colors in conditional formatting, which applies to the third visual. Adjusting these settings will therefore modify all visuals in the report accordingly.

Selected Answer: CD
The table uses the default colors of conditional formatting to show values in a range. These are the so-called "Divergent colors". The waterfall chart is one of the visuals that use "sentiment colors" as default colors. I don't see any theme colors benig used in the report except for the start and end values in the waterfall chart, so I wouldn't pick "Theme colors" in my answer...

Selected Answer: BC
theme and divergent

Selected Answer: BC
Divergent colors for accessibility issues; sentiment is for rules

comments.content:
Yes to the first one since personalize visual box is checked
No the second one and third because they are in view only access which disallow reshare and creating meausres

discussion.content:
Yes, No, No.
I believe the answer shown are correct.
For the second one, the viewer role does not have access to share/reshare: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-roles-new-workspaces

For third, there is no mention of being able to add a new measure:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/create-reports/power-bi-personalize-visuals?tabs=powerbi-desktop

Answer Yes-No-No.
User can personalize visuals (statement 1), but not share these personalizations with others (statement 2)

No No Yes, 
Yes because user can personalize the visuals
Yes Yes Yes

questions.question_text:
You need to use Power BI to create a visual that will allow users to compare the sales performance of five sales regions for the current month.

Which visual should you use?
